title: The Great Yordle Unification Pass
body:
I recall one of the artists talking about them wanting to do a pass on the yordles to bring them together more and create a more cohesive concept about what it means to be a yordle and most likely bringing them so that they were more in line with Lulu and Ziggs.  I believe this was Ironstylus that talked about it.  From my understanding this Great Yordle Unification Pass (GYUP?) is still a ways off and may not be until the end of this year or beginning of next year until it is complete.  With the VU that Heimerdinger now has received on the public beta client I am curious to hear more about what they have decided upon and how the new direction given to Heimer's character model may reflect what will come.   With the VU having come out first for Heimer due to his recent kit rework, what can we expect in regards to the GYUP releases?  Are they going to be coming out as they are ready or is there going to be a sudden influx of Yordle's with new makeup and hairdo's?  The Yordle VU that I am most looking forward to would have to be Tristana with Corki being a close second.  What are you looking forward to working on the most in the GYUP?

A lot of these questions are directed more specifically @IronStylus or whoever is working on these little guys but I am also interested in hearing more questions or speculations from the community.

replies.body:
Hi! I'm no IronStylus, but I think I can crack at some of this.

>From my understanding this Great Yordle Unification Pass (GYUP?) is still a ways off... 

Realistically, it'll be done when it's ready. We still have a bunch of high priority things we need to hit. (Though... hopefully sooner than later, I want more awesome yordles!)

>I am curious to hear more about what they have decided upon and how the new direction given to Heimer's character model may reflect what will come. 

Heimerdinger took a bunch of cues from Ziggs, but also built on top of that. We did some studies about Yordles as a whole, so a good amount of his VU was the groundwork for others!
I love what you did with the donger Ququroon. What's your role again? (The Beta doesn't support Rioter-roles and I am genuinely curious about what you do!)
It does, if you hover over the names! I'm QA for the Relaunch team.

WIZARDRY. 

QA I'm going to assume is Quality Assurance so that means you get the awesome job of playing everything before it comes out and then saying "Hey btw the donger's new arm is coming out of his face instead of his glorious hair"

Still, thanks for the speedy response. I appreciate the work ya' did and overall the final product certainly looks saucy.

QA (Quality Assurance) at Riot is actually pretty weird in comparison to the norm. I wear a lot of hats. Generally the main one is yeah, making sure nothing is buggy, but that's hardly the extent of things.

Heimerdinger looks awesome

If its not too much to ask, mind if I get your opinion on this


http://community.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/1j46ptjq-hey-relaunch-team-come-in-here-and-lets-talk

I want to be friends with you and take at least 8-9 of your hats. Maybe we can trade? Six refined and four crates?

Jesting aside, I have aspirations of working at Riot and I learned very quickly that people often do many jobs far outside of what their title would suggest. Pretty amazing in my opinion!
Do all future male Yordle VUs a have a full head of hair, since Heimerdinger set the standard for the ones to come

Thanks for the update. I'm actually super excited for this; I'm hopeful that we'll get some expanded lore on each Yordle and Yordles in general because of this! Plus Heimer looks really awesome; that perfect mix of intelligence and Yordle cuteness :D

BTW, Riot should totally coin that acronym **GYUP**. It sounds pretty Yordle-ish to me.
I'm excited to see what you guys will do with {{champion:42}}.  He looks a bit more like a dwarf than a proper yordle.

I really hope they make him a little furry guy, almost a cross between {{champion:74}} and {{champion:68}}. Obviously, he'd be an older yordle. I just hope they change Corki's dragonwing skin, because even though that skin is perfect for the current corki, he just looks like a little human which is not what it should be.

I don't think there needs to be a unifying of yordles...

Yes, it's true that they have kind of a bizarre sexual dimorphism thing going on. As far as I can tell, males are furry and females aren't, and both of them have kind of a technicolor skin thing going on. The only visible exception to that is Veigar, but it's not glaring because you can't actually see his body.

However, there's [real](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peafowl) [life](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anglerfish) examples of this sort of thing, and the way Yordles have been done in the past, while a little fantastical, is right for the tone of this game.

I don't think the sexual dimorphism(dichromatism?) will go away, but all male and all female Yordles will be brought in line with one another. Personal differences are fine, but since this is it's own species, there at least needs to be some consistencies.

Using your angler example (quite an extreme one I might add :P) males are always smaller than females, and always latch on. But males aren't just randomly as big as females. Or with Peafowl (think this is considered dichromatism, but your point is understood), the males have varying feather lengths, but they all have showy feathers that are never randomly absent. 

Now lets look at Yordles: males are furry, except Heim who has a huge brain-fro thing, and Corki, who has a mustache...? Then the females look like small humans mostly, except Lulu has ears and matches better with the males (more critter-like) and Trist just has human ears....you see what I'm getting at?

From what I can tell, they're going to keep the sexual dimorphism, since they're using Lulu as the model female yordle.  They might make the females slightly more feline-like, but I don't think they're going to push as far as "all yordles are now fuzzy".
And don't forget Veigar, he could use a whole revamp.
